questions.question: A farmer fences 1800 ft² into 3 equal pens with fencing parallel to one side. To minimize fencing, the side parallel to dividers should be:
questions.explanation: Area LW=1800 → W=1800/L. Fencing F=2L+4W=2L+7200/L. Minimize: F'(L)=2−7200/L²=0 → L²=3600 → L=60 ft.

questions.question: Largest rectangle inscribed in equilateral triangle side 10 (base on triangle base) has area:
questions.explanation: Rectangle corners symmetric: width=10−2a, height=√3a. Area A=(10−2a)(√3a). A'(a)=√3(10−4a)=0 → a=2.5 → width=5, height=2.5√3 → area=12.5√3.

questions.question: A right circular cone inscribed in sphere radius 5 has maximum volume when height =
questions.explanation: Let cone height h, sphere radius R=5. Volume V=π/3(2Rh²−h³) (derived). V'(h)=π/3(4Rh−3h²)=0 → h=4R/3=20/3.

questions.question: Aluminum gutter from 12-inch sheet (turn up edges 90°) has maximum water capacity when depth =
questions.explanation: Depth x, base width=12−2x. Cross-section area A=x(12−2x)=12x−2x². A'(x)=12−4x=0 → x=3 inches.

questions.question: Page with 96 in² print, margins: top/bottom 1″, sides 0.5″. Minimum paper occurs when print width ≈
questions.explanation: Print width w, height h: wh=96. Page area A=(w+1)(h+2)=98+2w+96/w. A'(w)=2−96/w²=0 → w²=48 → w=4√3≈6.93 in.

questions.explanation: Height y, short base length 2√(4−y²). Area A=2y+y√(4−y²). Optimize gives √(4−y²)=1 → y=√3 → area=3√3.
